  • incremental (bool) – boolean flag for whether to use incremental search mode or not

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.single_sample.QPE(operator, state_in, iqft, num_time_slices=1, num_ancillae=1, paulis_grouping='random', expansion_mode='trotter', expansion_order=1, shallow_circuit_concat=False)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm

The Quantum Phase Estimation algorithm.

CONFIGURATION = {'defaults': {'initial_state': {'name': 'ZERO'}, 'iqft': {'name': 'STANDARD'}}, 'depends': ['initial_state', 'iqft'], 'description': 'Quantum Phase Estimation for Quantum Systems', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'qpe_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'num_time_slices': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 1, 'minimum': 1}, 'paulis_grouping': {'type': 'string', 'default': 'random', 'oneOf': [{'enum': ['random', 'default']}]}, 'expansion_mode': {'type': 'string', 'default': 'trotter', 'oneOf': [{'enum': ['suzuki', 'trotter']}]}, 'expansion_order': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 1, 'minimum': 1}, 'num_ancillae': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 1, 'minimum': 1}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'QPE', 'problems': ['energy']}¶

__init__(operator, state_in, iqft, num_time_slices=1, num_ancillae=1, paulis_grouping='random', expansion_mode='trotter', expansion_order=1, shallow_circuit_concat=False)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • operator (Operator) – the hamiltonian Operator object
  • state_in (InitialState) – the InitialState pluggable component representing the initial quantum state
  • iqft (IQFT) – the Inverse Quantum Fourier Transform pluggable component
  • num_time_slices (int) – the number of time slices
  • num_ancillae (int) – the number of ancillary qubits to use for the measurement
  • paulis_grouping (str) – the pauli term grouping mode
  • expansion_mode (str) – the expansion mode (trotter|suzuki)
  • expansion_order (int) – the suzuki expansion order
  • shallow_circuit_concat (bool) – indicate whether to use shallow (cheap) mode for circuit concatenation
static check_pluggable_valid()¶

Checks if pluggable is ready for use. Throws an exception if not

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.single_sample.PhaseEstimation(operator, state_in, iqft, num_time_slices=1, num_ancillae=1, paulis_grouping='random', expansion_mode='trotter', expansion_order=1, state_in_circuit_factory=None, unitary_circuit_factory=None, shallow_circuit_concat=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

__init__(operator, state_in, iqft, num_time_slices=1, num_ancillae=1, paulis_grouping='random', expansion_mode='trotter', expansion_order=1, state_in_circuit_factory=None, unitary_circuit_factory=None, shallow_circuit_concat=False)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • operator (Operator) – the hamiltonian Operator object
  • state_in (InitialState) – the InitialState pluggable component representing the initial quantum state
  • iqft (IQFT) – the Inverse Quantum Fourier Transform pluggable component
  • num_time_slices (int) – the number of time slices
  • num_ancillae (int) – the number of ancillary qubits to use for the measurement
  • paulis_grouping (str) – the pauli term grouping mode
  • expansion_mode (str) – the expansion mode (trotter|suzuki)
  • expansion_order (int) – the suzuki expansion order
  • state_in_circuit_factory (CircuitFactory) – the initial state represented by a CircuitFactory object
  • unitary_circuit_factory (CircuitFactory) – the problem unitary represented by a CircuitFactory object
  • shallow_circuit_concat (bool) – indicate whether to use shallow (cheap) mode for circuit concatenation
construct_circuit(state_register=None, ancilla_register=None, aux_register=None, measure=False)[source]¶

Construct the Phase Estimation circuit

Parameters:
  • state_register (QuantumRegister) – the optional register to use for the quantum state
  • ancilla_register (QuantumRegister) – the optional register to use for the ancillary measurement qubits
  • aux_register (QuantumRegister) – an optional auxiliary quantum register
  • measure (bool) – boolean flag to indicate if the built circuit should include ancilla measurement
Returns:

the QuantumCircuit object for the constructed circuit
class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.single_sample.AmplitudeEstimation(num_eval_qubits, a_factory, q_factory=None, iqft=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm

The Amplitude Estimation algorithm.

CONFIGURATION = {'defaults': {'uncertainty_model': {'name': 'NormalDistribution'}, 'iqft': {'name': 'STANDARD'}}, 'depends': ['uncertainty_problem', 'uncertainty_model', 'iqft'], 'description': 'Amplitude Estimation Algorithm', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'AmplitudeEstimation_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'num_eval_qubits': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 5, 'minimum': 1}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'AmplitudeEstimation', 'problems': ['uncertainty']}¶
SECTION_KEY_ALGORITHM = 'algorithm'¶
SECTION_KEY_FEATURE_MAP = 'feature_map'¶
SECTION_KEY_INITIAL_STATE = 'initial_state'¶
SECTION_KEY_IQFT = 'iqft'¶
SECTION_KEY_MULTICLASS_EXTENSION = 'multiclass_extension'¶
SECTION_KEY_OPTIMIZER = 'optimizer'¶
SECTION_KEY_ORACLE = 'oracle'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_MODEL = 'uncertainty_model'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_PROBLEM = 'uncertainty_problem'¶
SECTION_KEY_VAR_FORM = 'variational_form'¶
__init__(num_eval_qubits, a_factory, q_factory=None, iqft=None)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • num_eval_qubits (int) – number of evaluation qubits
  • a_factory (CircuitFactory) – the CircuitFactory subclass object representing the problem unitary
  • q_factory (CircuitFactory) – the CircuitFactory subclass object representing an amplitude estimation sample (based on a_factory)
  • iqft (IQFT) – the Inverse Quantum Fourier Transform pluggable component, defaults to using a standard iqft when None

Checks if pluggable is ready for use. Throws an exception if not
